00042 namespace {
00043 
00044 class generator_t {
00045     public:
00046     typedef base_random_generator::result_type result_type;
00047     typedef boost::mt19937 default_random_t;
00048 
00049     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00050         generator_t() { mLock.lock(); init(); }
00051         ~generator_t() { mLock.unlock(); }
00052     #else
00053         generator_t() { init(); }
00054     #endif
00055 
00056     result_type operator()() { return mGeneratorObj->operator()(); }
00057 
00058     static void set_generator(base_random_generator *p) { mGeneratorObj.reset(p); }
00059 
00060     private:
00061     void init() {
00062         if (mGeneratorObj.get() == 0) {
00063             typedef default_random_t T;
00064             T *genobj(new T(boost::uint32_t(time(0)+clock())));
00065             random_generator<T> *obj=new random_generator<T>(genobj);
00066             set_generator(obj);
00067         }
00068     }
00069 
00070     static std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> mGeneratorObj;
00071 
00072     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00073         static boost::mutex mLock;
00074     #endif
00075 };
00076 
00077 std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> generator_t::mGeneratorObj;
00078 
00079 #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00080     boost::mutex generator_t::mLock;
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 } // namespace

00085 namespace detail {

00087 void set_random_generator(base_random_generator *obj) {
00088     generator_t::set_generator(obj);
00089 }

00091 unsigned int get_random() {
00092     generator_t gen;
00093     return gen();
00094 }

00099 // The secure random generator
00100 
00102 #ifdef _WIN32
00103     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00104         typedef BOOLEAN (WINAPI *RtlGenRandomFn)(PVOID, ULONG);
00105         typedef DWORD result_type;
00106 
00107         impl_t(): dll(0), fn(0) {
00108             // This should work under WinXP, Vista, and Win7. No guarantees about
00109             // future compatibility, but I doubt that Microsoft will get rid of it
00110             // (it's too useful), and I doubt that they'll change it now that it's
00111             // well-known (it would break too many programs). We could also use the
00112             // rand_s function in more recent versions of Visual C++, but that
00113             // causes compatibility problems with older versions of Windows.
00114             dll=LoadLibraryA("Advapi32.dll");
00115             if (dll != 0) fn=RtlGenRandomFn(GetProcAddress(dll, "SystemFunction036"));
00116             if (fn == 0) {
00117                 destroy();
00118                 throw no_strong_random();
00119             }
00120         }
00121 
00122         ~impl_t() { destroy(); }
00123 
00124         result_type operator()() {
00125             result_type r=0;
00126             if (!fn(&r, sizeof(result_type)))
00127                 throw no_strong_random("RtlGenRandom failed");
00128             return r;
00129         }
00130 
00131         void destroy() { if (dll) FreeLibrary(dll); }
00132 
00133         HMODULE dll;
00134         RtlGenRandomFn fn;
00135     };
00136 
00137     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 32; }
00138 #else
00139     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00140         typedef unsigned char result_type;
00141 
00142         impl_t(): rng("/dev/urandom", std::ios::binary) {
00143             // This should be supported under most non-Windows systems. Note
00144             // that we're using /dev/urandom, not /dev/random -- /dev/random is
00145             // more secure, but it can be VERY slow.
00146             if (!rng) throw no_strong_random();
00147         }
00148 
00149         result_type operator()() {
00150             int r=rng.get();
00151             if (r==EOF) throw no_strong_random("/dev/urandom returned EOF");
00152             return static_cast<result_type>(r);
00153         }
00154 
00155         std::ifstream rng;
00156     };
00157 
00158     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 8; }
00159 #endif
00161 
00162 const bool strong_random_generator::has_fixed_range = true;
00163 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min_value =
00164     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::min)();
00165 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max_value =
00166     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::max)();
00167 strong_random_generator::strong_random_generator(): impl(new impl_t) { }
00168 strong_random_generator::~strong_random_generator() { delete impl; }
00169 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::operator()() {
00170     return (*impl)(); }
00171 
00173 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min
00174     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return min_value; }
00175 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max
00176     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return max_value; }

00180 // Returns a positive (unless told otherwise) integer between zero and
00181 // (1<<bits)-1, inclusive
00182 
00183 namespace core {
00184 integer random_by_size(size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool
00185     can_be_negative)
00186 {
00187     if (bits<=0) return integer::zero();
00188 
00189     generator_t randomGenerator;
00190     const size_t cBitsPerIteration=std::numeric_limits<generator_t::result_type>::digits;
00191 
00192     // Grab a set of random bits, of at least the specified size
00193     size_t iterations = (bits+cBitsPerIteration-1) / cBitsPerIteration;
00194     std::vector<generator_t::result_type> v;
00195     for (size_t i=0; i<iterations; ++i) v.push_back(randomGenerator());
00196 
00197     const char *vptr=(const char *)&v[0], *vptr_end=vptr+(v.size() * sizeof(generator_t::result_type));
00198     integer p=from_binary(std::string(vptr, vptr_end));
00199 
00200     // Trim it to the proper length
00201     size_t index=(bits/bits_per_digit);
00202     digit_t mask=(digit_t(1) << (bits % bits_per_digit))-1;
00203     if (mask==0) { mask=digit_mask; --index; }
00204     p._get_data()->digits[index] &= mask;
00205     for (digit_t *i=p._get_data()->digits+index+1,
00206         *ie=p._get_data()->digits+p._get_data()->mLength; i<ie; ++i) *i=0;
00207     p._get_data()->skipLeadingZeros();
00208 
00209     if (high_bit_on) setbit(p, bits-1);
00210     if (low_bit_on) setbit(p, 0);
00211     if (can_be_negative) p._set_negative(randomGenerator() & 0x01);
00212 
00213     return p;
00214 }
00215 } // namespace core
00216 
00237 integer random_by_size(size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool
00238     can_be_negative)
00239 {
00240     try {
00241         return integer(core::random_by_size(bits, high_bit_on, low_bit_on,
00242             can_be_negative));
00243     } catch (std::exception&) {
00244         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw;
00245         return integer::nan();
00246     }
00247 }
